body.name: Elite Gourmet ETO2530M Double French Door Countertop Toaster Oven, Bake, Broil, Toast, Keep Warm, Fits 12" pizza, 25L capacity, Stainless Steel & Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 7 hrs 21 mins
FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 7 hrs 21 mins
features: 25L XL CAPACITY: Fits 6 slices of toast and cooks up to an 11lb roast. Three rack positions plus 0.9cuft capacity can fit up to a 12" pizza with interior dimensions of 13.25"x 13.50"x 8.95".
FRENCH DUAL DOOR DESIGN allows you to open one or both doors at a time saving precious counter space. Three rack positions allow you to cook multiple dishes at once.
PRECISION COOKING CONTROL: The built-in heat selector switch allows you to select numerous cooking features for Baking, Broiling, Toasting, Pizza and Keep Warm.
ADJUSTABLE TIMER: The oven includes a 60-Minute timer with indicator bell and toast shade settings.
1500 WATTS OF POWER: Optimize your cooking needs with an adjustable thermostat from 200°F to 450°F and 1500 watts of cooking power
body.description: Introducing the Elite Gourmet Double French Door 25L Countertop Oven. The perfect stand-in or supplement to conventional ovens. This dual door convection oven will have you forget about your traditional oven altogether! Toast, bake, broil, and roast your way to delicious, hearty meals and decadent desserts - this oven can do it all! The spacious interior boasts 3 rack positions so you can bake a 12" Pizza, warm dinner rolls, and broil a casserole all at Gourmet Double Door countertop oven. Includes French-style doors, 1 x wire rack, 1 enamel bake tray, crumb tray and a tray removal handle. Removable parts are all dishwasher safe. Avoid heating up your kitchen with a big conventional oven, save time and use less energy with the Elite Gourmet Double French Door Countertop Oven, the perfect supplement for the holidays when your kitchen needs goes on double duty!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great overall counter top oven
reviews.reviewText: Counter top oven works just like a range oven, using less power. Quick to preheat. Large enough to hold a 22 lbs turkey or roast, or two large pizzas. Very easy to clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Updated Probably deserves 4 stats but Love It
reviews.reviewText: It has now been a year. This oven is heavily used daily. 3 teenagers baking frozen foodsand I use it almost daily to make dinner. The temp no longer reaches 450⁰ but it holds at about 380⁰ which works just fine. I am still happy with it.Was delivered yesterday so cannot attest to longevity. But Love this oven. I replaced another that never worked right. For reference we are a house of 5 with 3 being teenagers. So in 24 hrs this little oven has seen a lot of use.Pros. Easily fits a 13x9 cassarole pan. Gets HOT fast. First thing I tested was temp. Set to 350⁰ my prone read and held 368⁰. At 450⁰ held 488⁰. Possibly high due to probe being very close to racks but higher for my liking is better anyway.Top and sides do get hot to the touch. My kids act as if it is on fire. It is not but it dies get hot to the touch. I can touch it briefly. Under cabinet got warm on the bottom but nothing concerning.Convection works well. Hoping to airfry soon. Have not tested rotisserie.Doirs open on both sides. Read Cons for tip on thisCONS-BE VERY CAREFUL REMOVING FOID. The racks are weak. And will cave if pulled out. This is an easy fix. Only pull the rack out about 1 inch to hold doors open then use oven cgloces to remove food. Problem solved with ZERO burnsThis will be hard to clean. I know because my last one was same design. But it is a damn oven they are never easy to clean.No always on feature. Frankly, my last had this feature I used it once to see it work. Necer used it again in 3 yrs. If more time us needed jyst turn the dial.All in all uf this little guy lasts 2 yrs or more I will be absolutely estatic. Well worth the price for that length of time. Fingers crossed

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Large enough to really cook a meal
reviews.reviewText: We've had some small toaster ovens the last couple of years and were having to cut a pizza in half just to cook one for the two of us; it's so nice to have a countertop oven that we can cook for two and more in! I love the simplicity of this thing - you know how there are so many preset buttons on everything now, it can be confusing and just unnecessary. I almost always use the same setting and amount of time for most of what we cook anyway. Of course, with every new gadget you get, you've got to learn all about it, and this was easy and quick to get the hang of.There is one rack and one tray, but as the picture shows, you can use them both for cooking a bunch at once. Because it's big enough to reach in, it's easy to clean inside. It has cooked all our food evenly so far, but our experience has been once you have a small oven for about a year and a half, things begin to not cook as well. That's why it's nice that this one doesn't cost so much since I already figure I'll be getting a new one after that long, but who knows - maybe this one will last longer than that before it starts declining.I do love the look of it, it's just kind of fascinating to see it on our counter! Some cons to note: the doors open together, so I'm always surprised when I reach for one door and the other opens too - don't stand too close while you open it thinking just one side will open or you might get hit by the other ... LOL ... Also, as we all know, the metal parts are going to get very hot and I always watch out for that, but there's a tiny metal piece at the inside top of the glass door that I didn't see. Once I brushed past that as I opened the door and got slightly burned - just enough to hurt a little while but not blister or anything, so watch out for that. And last of all my cons, as one reviewer mentioned (and I'm glad she did) the rack will tip backward when you pull it out and you could get burned or possibly have all your food slide backward and have a mess. This happens because the bumps or whatever you call them on the sides of the oven that hold the rack have a significant gap between the front and back; when the rack reaches that gap, there's nothing holding it up except the front one, so that makes it tilt backward.But I've already told my friends I love this thing and I definitely recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cooks nearly as well as an oven
reviews.reviewText: I debated between this toaster oven and two others that cost 3 and 4x more. For just under $80, I feel that I made the right choice :) I’m happy with it. I use it a few times a month and really only cook salmon, green veggies, and butternut squash or sweets potatoes, with the occasional frozen pizza and toast from time to time and I have zero complaints. The only thing that would improve this item for me was if it came with an extra pan, but I think all toaster ovens typically only come with one. You should note that the double doors, the sides, and recently, even the knobs on the control panel get very hot! I’ve burned myself two or three times already with this toaster oven an even though I try to be careful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A decent product
reviews.reviewText: This product does bake, broil, toast and rotisserie. It's pretty easy to use. Clean up is easy. The tempetures are accurate. The double doors help keep from burning yourself. can fit a 9 x 13 inch glass baking dish, a whole chicken, whole Turkey breast, butt end ham, with ease. Haven't had an issue yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Would score it as 3.5 if that were an option. Actually works great but the thermostat is "iffy"
reviews.reviewText: The oven is nice and works very well, I love the option to set the temp on the upper and lower elements at the same time but the cooking temperature of the oven is off by up to 20 degrees. I have a separate oven thermometer inside as a check. As long as you are aware of that and keep an eye on whatever you are cooking it's a great deal for the price. I have noticed that the convection fan does scorch food on the right side of the over, nearest to the fan but I remedied that by rotating the pan. The dials are a little hard to see, the numbers on the thermostats are small. This on takes a little getting used to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars More than a toaster!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this for my husbands’s toast and hot sandwiches but it will actually cook small pizzas and the oven goes up to 450 degrees. It has a timer for toast, or anything you cook and will automatically turn off. It looks very well in any space.I particularly like the chef doors and it has a thin cleanup tray in the bottom for easy cleanup.this is well worth the cash!
CREO QUE EL MEJOR HORNO(MARCA) QUE HE TENIDO 10 ESTRELLAS HASTA HOY
Funciona bien lo que no me gustó es que las perillas son diferentes a las fotos de ahí en fuera todo genial
This little oven is a lot more powerful tha anticipated..., Best for the price!!

Ce petit four est une merveille ! Pour un petit logement cela est idéal. La plaque du dessus cuit très bien, facile à nettoyer mais laisse des traces dès le premier usage. La rotisserie du poulet est délicieuse. J'ai regarder plusieurs vidéo sur youtube concernant ce produits et jusqu'a maintenant très veridique. Utilisation presque quotidienne et je ne regrette pas mon achat.

reviews.reviewTitle: this product works well so far
reviews.reviewText: toast is almost too fast although the temp can be reduced slowing it down as wanted . The convection aspect is quite delightful in keeping foods juicy when cooked ,not dried out .
